title: Ash Handley
text:
Ashley Handley (born 16 February 1996) is an English <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who plays as a er and for the <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds Rhinos</a> in the <a href="Super%20League">Super League</a>.
He has spent time on loan from <a href="Leeds%20Rhinos">Leeds</a> at <a href="Featherstone%20Rovers">Featherstone Rovers</a> in the <a href="RFL%20Championship">Championship</a>.
Background.
Handley was born in <a href="Leeds">Leeds</a>, <a href="Yorkshire">Yorkshire</a>, England.
Career.
Handley played for amateur side Oulton Raiders before signing for Leeds Rhinos. He made his first team début against <a href="London%20Broncos">London Broncos</a> in August 2014. This was Handley's only first team appearance during the <a href="Super%20League%20XIX">2014 Super League season</a>, and his next first team appearance was in the 2014 Boxing Day friendly fixture against <a href="Wakefield%20Trinity">Wakefield Trinity Wildcats</a> when he scored five tries as Leeds won 50-28.
For the <a href="Super%20League%20XX">2015 Super League season</a>, Handley was called in the first team squad and scored two tries on his Super League home début as Leeds defeated <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan Warriors</a> on 20 March 2015.
Assigned squad number 27, Handley established himself as a first team regular and scored a first-half <a href="hat%20trick">hat trick</a> against <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St Helens</a> in April 2015 With the second hat-trick coming in July 2015 against the same club - St Helens.
Handley has been awarded a place in the main squad in 2016 after his fantastic performance in this year's Rhinos treble winning season, he has been given the 22 Jersey. From the 2019 season, Handley wore the number 5 Jersey replacing Ryan Hall.
On 17 October 2020, he scored two tries for Leeds in the <a href="2020%20Challenge%20Cup%20Final">2020 Challenge Cup Final</a> victory over Salford at <a href="Wembley%20Stadium">Wembley Stadium</a>.
International career.
In July 2018 he was selected in the <a href="England%20Knights">England Knights</a> Performance squad. Later that year he was selected for the England Knights on their tour of <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea">Papua New Guinea</a>. He played against <a href="Papua%20New%20Guinea%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Papua New Guinea</a> at the <a href="Oil%20Search%20National%20Football%20Stadium">Oil Search National Football Stadium</a>.
He was selected in <a href="England%209s">England 9s</a> squad for the <a href="2019%20Rugby%20League%20World%20Cup%209s">2019 Rugby League World Cup 9s</a>.
